tn.text: John begins to describe a vision of an angel throwing the devil into the bottomless pit.
Here "I" refers to John.

This is an extremely deep narrow hole. Possible meanings are 1) the pit has no bottom; it continues to go down further forever or 2) the pit is so deep that it is as if it had no bottom. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:09:01|9:1]].
his was a large, fierce reptile, like a lizard. For Jewish people, it was a symbol of evil and chaos. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_symlanguage]])
The angel sealed the pit to keep anyone from opening it. AT: "sealed it to prevent anyone from opening it" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Here "nations" is a metonym for the people of the earth. AT: "deceive the people-groups" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"1,000 years" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will command the angel to free him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is the next part of John's vision. He describes suddenly seeing thrones and the souls of believers.

tn.ref: who had been given authority to judge
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "whom God had given authority to judge" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "whose heads others had cut off" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"because they had spoken the truth about Jesus" (UDB)
"They came back to life" or "They became alive again" (UDB)
"All of the other dead people"
"the end of the 1,000 years" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: Over these the second death has no power
tn.text: Here John describes "death" as a person with power. AT: "These people will not experience the second death" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

"dying a second time." This is described as eternal punishment in the lake of fire in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:20:13|20:14]] and [[:en:bible:notes:rev:21:07|21:08]]. AT: "the final death in the lake of fire." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:02:10|2:11]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_symlanguage]])

tn.ref: Satan will be released from his prison
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will release Satan from his prison" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: at the four corners of the earth
tn.text: This is an idiom that means "all over the earth" (UDB). See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:07:01|7:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
These are the names that the prophet Ezekiel used to represent faraway countries. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: They will be as many as the sand of the sea
tn.text: This emphasizes the extremely large number of soldiers in Satan's army. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
"Satan's army went"
This refers to Jerusalem.

tn.ref: fire came down from heaven and devoured them
tn.text: Here John speaks of fire as if it were alive. AT: "God sent fire from heaven to burn them up" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

tn.ref: The devil, who deceived them, was thrown
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God threw the devil who had deceived them" or "God's angel threw the devil, who had deceived them," (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"the lake of fire that burns with sulfur" (UDB) or "place full of fire that burns with sulfur." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:19:19|19:20]].

tn.ref: where the beast and the false prophet had been thrown
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "where he had also thrown the beast and the false prophet" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "God will torment them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is the next part of John's vision. He describes suddenly seeing a great white throne and the dead being judged.

tn.ref: The earth and the heaven fled away from his presence, but there was no place for them to go
tn.text: John describes heaven and earth as if they were people who were trying to escape God's judgment. This means that God completely destroyed the old heaven and earth. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
John combines these opposite-meaning words to mean all of the dead people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_merism]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "someone opened the books" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "God judged the people who had died and now lived again" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "by what he had recorded" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: The sea gave up the dead ... Death and hades gave up the dead
tn.text: Here John speaks of the sea, death, and hades as if they were living persons.  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "God judged the dead people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "God threw death and hades" or "God's angel threw death and hades" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Here "hades" is a metonym that represents the place where unbelievers go when they die, to wait for God's judgment. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

"dying a second time." This is described as eternal punishment in the lake of fire in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:20:13|20:14]] and [[:en:bible:notes:rev:21:07|21:08]]. AT: "the final death in the lake of fire." See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:rev:02:10|2:11]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_symlanguage]])

tn.ref: If anyone's name was not found written
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "If God's angel did not find a person's name" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: he was thrown into the lake of fire
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the angel threw him into the lake of fire" or "the angel threw him into the place where fire burns forever" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
